pr_title: Add query methods that return Slice to DatastoreTemplate to allow pagination

timeline.bodyText: Copyright 2017-2020
timeline.author: dzou
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,51 @@
+/*
+ * Copyright 2019-2019 the original author or authors.

timeline.bodyText:
I don't think this is quite the right approach; it seems a bit heavyweight to create a new class to hold a boolean.
Also the only method that returns this is nextPageAwareQuery; however, other query methods such as query, queryIterable, and queryByExample also return DatastoreResultsIterable but are not able to take advantage of the next-page-aware feature.
I would try to get DatastoreResultsIterable to have access to the hasNextPage somehow.
I would suggest a couple alternatives:


Is it possible to add a method to DatastoreTemplate like hasNextPage(Cursor c) or hasNextPage(DatastoreResultsIterable i)? if so, the user can manually check for next page through usage of template.


If the query is cheap, you might as well pay the cost of nextPageExists(..) for each DatastoreResultsIterable; and build the hasNextPage parameter in there. no need for premature optimization


Add a method called hasNextPage() on the DatastoreResultsIterable which will run the query of checking if the cursor has a next page. This would require the Iterable obj have reference to the datastore client I suppose.
timeline.author: dzou
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,51 @@

+
+package org.springframework.cloud.gcp.data.datastore.core;
+
+import java.util.Iterator;
+
+import com.google.cloud.datastore.Cursor;
+
+/**
+ * An iterable that contains a cursor for the next page and can be used to determine
+ * if the next page exists.
+ *
+ * @author Dmitry Solomakha
+ */
+public class DatastoreNextPageAwareResultsIterable<T> implements Iterable<T> {

timeline.bodyText: Can we just move this code to hasNextPage in the Iterable?
timeline.author: meltsufin

timeline.bodyText: You can just return here without assigning to pageable.
timeline.author: meltsufin

timeline.bodyText:
why not just
public boolean hasNextPage()?
timeline.author: meltsufin

replies.bodyText: @meltsufin Because it is not always there. We can only compute it for StructuredQuery queries, and we can't compute it for GQL queries. So we need to represent 3 values - true, false, empty.
replies.author: dmitry-s

replies.bodyText:
@dmitry-s I must be missing something here. Both, GqlQuery and StructuredQuery, support cursors. So, I would image that it's possible to try to retrieve the next item using the cursor to determine hasNext(). How are they different in this respect?
Also, if there is a fundamental difference, then we should probably have two different classes for their results. So, maybe extend DatastoreResultsIterable and add hasNextPage()?
replies.author: meltsufin

replies.bodyText: The problem with GqlQuery is we need to set limit to 1 to avoid fetching the whole next page, and GqlQuery doesn't allow to change that.
replies.author: dmitry-s

replies.bodyText: So, for GqlQuery we would need to fetch the whole page? Is there a problem with that other than the potential performance overhead?
replies.author: meltsufin

timeline.bodyText: I don't think a public setter makes sense here. Can you just provide all the necessary objects to determine hasNextPage into the constructor?
timeline.author: meltsufin

timeline.bodyText:
Instead of calling setHasNextPageQuery can this block of code just move to DatastoreResultsIterable?
Also, why does this only apply to StructuredQuery?
timeline.author: meltsufin

timeline.message: Merge branch 'master' of github.com:spring-cloud/spring-cloud-gcp into datastore-iterable-nextpage

timeline.bodyText: Never used.
timeline.author: meltsufin

timeline.bodyText: DatastoreStructuredQueryResultsIterable maybe?

timeline.bodyText:
Can we extend SliceImpl such that hasNextPage() is lazy?
Feel free to leave for another PR though.
timeline.author: meltsufin

replies.bodyText: I don't think it is necessary because if you don't need  hasNextPage(), you could just use the queryKeysOrEntities method instead.
replies.author: dmitry-s

replies.bodyText: What about the use in repositories?
replies.author: meltsufin

timeline.bodyText:
Can you remind me, what is the benefit of combining queryEntities() and queryKeys() into one method?
Sonar is identifying this as a "code smell".
